input:
Which statement is sarcastic?
Options:
(A) A wave of hypothermia and drownings will be a great way to start the year
(B) A wave of hypothermia and drownings will be a terrible way to start the year

Which statement is sarcastic?
Options:
(A) The best way to defeat a stronger/larger and better regimented force is by fighting on their terms
(B) The best way to defeat a stronger/larger and better regimented force is by fighting on your terms

Which statement is sarcastic?
Options:
(A) One of the worst things to do working in retail was pushing a trolley of returns around the store putting them back
(B) One of the enjoyable things to do working in retail was pushing a trolley of returns around the store putting them back

Which statement is sarcastic?
Options:
(A) Have you tried not being poor? It is much easier
(B) Have you tried not being rude? It is much easier

Which statement is sarcastic?
Options:
(A) Yeah, the Christian church had such a lock in Buddhist China
(B) Yeah, the Christian church had such a struggle in Buddhist China

Which statement is sarcastic?
Options:
(A) Stop putting people in neat little compartments to protect your view point — good idea
(B) Keep putting people in neat little compartments to protect your view point — good idea

Which statement is sarcastic?
Options:
(A) We all know diamonds are valuable
(B) We all know diamonds are worthless

Which statement is sarcastic?
Options:
(A) And the likelihood of internet-connected cars being hacked and controlled remotely,....zero
(B) And the likelihood of internet-connected cars being hacked and controlled remotely,....high

Which statement is sarcastic?
Options:
(A) We should start a petition to ban breathing
(B) We should start a petition to ban vaping

Which statement is sarcastic?
Options:
(A) Working the printer is too complex for me
(B) Working the microprocessor is too complex for me

Which statement is sarcastic?
Options:
(A) One of the worst things to do working in retail was pushing a trolley of returns around the store putting them back
(B) One of the enjoyable things to do working in retail was pushing a trolley of returns around the store putting them back

Which statement is sarcastic?
Options:
(A) Yeah, let's crucify this nonprofit for making money, they shouldn't be doing that
(B) Yeah, let's crucify this company for making money, they shouldn't be doing that

Which statement is sarcastic?
Options:
(A) What a wonderful, baseless accusation
(B) What a striking, baseless accusation

Which statement is sarcastic?
Options:
(A) Wow, you only applied to 200 internships this past week?
(B) Wow, you only applied to 2 internships this past week?

Which statement is sarcastic?
Options:
(A) But his eyes were on the ball, shouldn't be a red
(B) But his cleats were on the ball, shouldn't be a red

Which statement is sarcastic?
Options:
(A) That violent oppressive dictator didn't think that people would get mad at him? How pragmatic
(B) That violent oppressive dictator didn't think that people would get mad at him? How naive

Which statement is sarcastic?
Options:
(A) Yeah. Let's get rid of the trams and build carriages instead
(B) Yeah. Let's get rid of the trams and build lightrail instead

Which statement is sarcastic?
Options:
(A) SCIENCE CAUSES VACCINES!
(B) EVOLUTION CAUSES VACCINES!

Which statement is sarcastic?
Options:
(A) Just like we're all better off for not spinning our own clothes, mining our own steel, and forging our own tools
(B) Just like we're all worse off for not spinning our own clothes, mining our own steel, and forging our own tools

Which statement is sarcastic?
Options:
(A) Remind me, how do you print a legal-sized piece of paper?
(B) Remind me, how do you print a blank piece of paper?
